 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Linux
* Windows
* Java
* C++
* SQL
* Erfarenhet av systemet Kondor+


**Meriterande**
* grundläggande kunskap inom finansiella instrument samt erfarenhet av TeamCity och livscykelhantering av system.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 13-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Visual Content Producer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Visual Content Producer for H&M Group Communications, you will be part of the Project & Production Management team, and work alongside your inhouse Studio colleagues producing elevated digital content in cooperation with other team members for owned channels such as hmgroup.com, LinkedIn as well as internal channels. You will be responsible for ensuring a professional process from start to finish and you ensure that the outcome meets quality requirements i.e. there is consistency across the productions and that we follow the brand direction and tone of voice. You manage several different types of productions and are expected to, together with the studio team, setting up installations, calibrations, rigging, filming and taking photos and day-to-day maintenance of the equipment.
   

  

*Your responsibilities as Visual Content Producer will include, but not be limited to:*
 → Planning and executing video productions from the start to the final stage of the production, including storyboard, shoot, editing, retouching, animations, text, music, etc.
   

  

 → Recording internal live events and small-scale video productions.
   

  

 → Ensuring that our visual ID is followed in high-quality videos and images.
   

  

 → Ensuring that photo and video equipment are fully functional and according to standards.
   

  

 → Supporting and providing technical guidance on live events and digital meetings, incl. training material and video tutorials for internal stakeholders.
   

  

 → Staying informed on global media trends and continuously explore ways to improve content.
   

  

 → Collaborate and continuous dialogue with different key stakeholders.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You will report to the Head of Project & Production Management and be part of the Project & Production Management team where we include a small inhouse digital Studio team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
 → Experience in photography, both for still and moving imagery.
   

  

 → Experience from working with on-set production as well as post-production, preferably from the fashion or lifestyle industry.
   

  

 → Experience working in a fast-paced environment with several productions and projects ongoing.
   

  

 → Strong knowledge of lighting techniques and camera equipment.
   

  

 → Fluency in Adobe Premiere Pro, Photoshop and familiar with After Effects.
   

  

*And people who are…*
 → Creative and not afraid to try new ways of working/thinking outside the box
   

  

 → Highly motivated, adaptable and self-driven; capable of working independently, yet collaboratively, within a fast-paced environment
   

  

 → Structured and are able juggle different tasks, with focus on prioritization and meeting deadlines
   

  

 → A people-person with a can-do attitude who loves teamwork.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 → 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
   

  

 → H&M Incentive Program – HIP
   

  

**Additional Information**
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


 This is a full-time permanent position and you will be located in our office in Marievik, Stockholm. Does this sound interesting? Please apply here (with CV) and a portfolio as soon as possible, but no later than  17th March 2025.

title: Solution Architect - PB Fulfillment Area
description:
**Job Description**
**This is opportunity to join team of Solution Architects working on cutting edge retail solutions within our company within several different areas from product creation, through logistics, to sales in store or online.**
 As a Solution Architect for Portfolio Brands, you will work with stakeholders in different Brands in the Group and play a critical role in driving growth, profitability, and scalability across both digital and retail domains. This position requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of technology solutions and their application in the fashion retail industry.
   

  

 In this role as Solution Architect, you will be responsible for translating business and tech requirements into architecture blueprints. You will also conduct thorough analysis of existing solutions, identify gaps, and recommend improvements. To deliver in this role you will have to evaluate the architecture holistically, use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of technical components, and give recommendations and guidelines for teams implementing solutions.
   

  

 You want work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and open to change. You show commitment and ownership and demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy, architectural governance and standards. Effective team player that can express the importance of technical concepts and quality, emerging technologies, ideas, feelings, opinions, and conclusions to peers and people with an only limited technical background and contribute positively to your team environment.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect for
 ***Fulfillment***
 Area.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating technical alignment for the full solution rather than concerns for specific components.
* Review, analyze, develop and facilitate stakeholder understanding of business and technology implication of future direction, roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Create architectural design to guide and contextualize solution development across initiatives that aligns with business and IT goals.
* Provide necessary leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of technology solutions to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and standards.
* Identify interdependencies and use ‘holistic thinking’ to ensure the cross-team perspective. Provide consulting support around solution architecture to teams to ensure a product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
* Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and document all solution architecture design and analysis.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Work continuously with incorporating broader aspects such as overall product costs/revenue, data privacy & sovereignty, business continuity, information security, integration with other systems, etc.
* Facilitate best practice sharing and teach architecture thinking to engineering and product community.
* Take ownership and responsibility of current solutions and flows and ensure secure and stable operations with good focus on resolving recurring problems to the root cause.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT with experience in Solution architecture in the retail or fashion industry.
* Proven track record in designing and implementing scalable solutions in digital and retail environments.
* Experience in working with SAP, Salesforce etc.
* Experience in working in complex landscape with a combination of cloud solution and Enterprise Applications such as SAP.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, microservices architecture, APIs, and integration frameworks.
* Ability to understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specification.
* Experience of planning and driving workshops with implementation teams, architects as well as business stakeholders.
* Ability to work with composability frameworks and support to define Packaged Business Capabilities (PBCs) to ensure scalable and modular architectural solutions.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Head of Information Security
description:
We are super excited to announce that our CIO Magnus Ahlberg is now looking to welcome our next Head of Information Security. In this role, you’ll be the forefront of safeguarding our company and raising awareness of risk management while enabling innovation and growth.
   

  

**About The Role And Day-to-day**
 As the Head of Information Security you will lead and drive the security strategy, ensuring that our teams are empowered to deliver secure, cutting-edge solutions with streamlined processes. An essential part will be to coach the organization in security related topics, setting up processes to enable continuously improvement to mitigate the level of risk to the organization. This includes:
   

  

* Leading the company's information security strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and fostering a security-conscious culture.
* Driving the ISO 27001 certification project to completion, including risk management, process rollout, and compliance with key security frameworks.
* Establishing secure software development practices, including product risk management, vulnerability management, and security architecture.
* Serving as the subject matter expert and advisor for internal stakeholders, promoting security awareness and best practices company-wide.


**So who are you?**
 We believe you have a solid background of success in dynamic fast-growing international businesses. You excel at driving change by engaging and inspiring to adopt secure practices through clear communication and leadership. With excellent relationships skills with internal and external stakeholders you are serving as the go-to person for security related initiatives and questions. After all, security is about creating solutions that empower everyone, right?
   

  

 In addition to your personal attributes, you probably have:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in working with information security
* Experience implementing or maintaining ISO 27001 certification and/or SOC2 compliance in a tech company
* Knowledge of secure development practices within software development
* Knowledge in the area of data privacy legislation, mainly GDPR and best practices for technical and organizational security from a legal perspective


**What's in it for you?**
 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Security Administrator
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Security Administrator to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Security Administrator who wants to make a difference.
   

  

**Group Functions**
 Truesec consists of several Business Units who act as partners towards our customers within various different areas of cyber security. The group function supports with e.g. Information Security, Governance Risk and Compliance, Marketing, People & Culture, and Finance and do so both locally and globally. All functions act and collaborate with the organization with a business objective in mind as the tasks are crucial for Truesec to continue to prevent cyber breach and minimize impact.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Security Administrator, you will belong to and work within our Global Security and Compliance function. This function is responsible for managing, among other things, Information Security, Compliance, Standards, ESG, as well as physical and personnel security at Truesec.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible, in collaboration with the Global Security and Compliance function, for driving the security protection work throughout Truesec. This includes providing operational and daily support, as well as engaging in preventive and strategic work aimed at continuous improvement initiatives. You will compile and communicate necessary security protection instructions, procedures, and documents to relevant parties within Truesec.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 To thrive in this position, you should:
   

  

* Have relevant knowledge of the Security Protection Act and its application.
* Have a general understanding of other applicable laws and requirements regarding our Global Security and Compliance function.
* Adapt quickly to changes and find it easy to learn company operational systems, including their structure and function.
* Have a positive attitude and drive your work in accordance with the organization’s decisions, goals, and guidelines.
* Make well-informed assessments and demonstrate good judgment in your actions and decision-making.
* Have an interest in and a desire to stay up to date within the spectrum of laws and regulations connected to Information Security, Standards, and Compliance.
* Possess good planning and organizing skills, can prioritize effectively, and work according to set timelines.


**Required Skills**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have most of the following skills:
   

  

* Administrative Competency: Strong focus on administrative tasks related to security protection agreements and security clearances.
* Operational Support: Ability to manage daily tasks connected to security, compliance, and Information Security effectively.
* Development Skills: Capable of developing processes related to security and compliance and keeping the organization informed.
* Assessment Skills: Proficient in conducting assessments and ensuring compliance with applicable regulations.
* Strong Verbal and Written Communication: Proficiency in both Swedish and English for effective interaction with stakeholders.


**Bonus Skills**
 While not required, the following skills would be advantageous:
   

  

* Project Management: Experience in managing projects and driving processes related to security, compliance, and Information Security.
* Training Experience: Background in conducting training sessions on security and compliance topics.
* ESG Experience: Have experience working with compliance related to ESG & Sustainability


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Marketing Automation & CX consultant
description:
Leadfront växer snabbt och vi letar nu efter flera CX & Marketing Automation konsulter som vill bli en del av vårt team. Vi arbetar med kunder som använder ledande plattformar som Adobe Campaign, Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud och Symplify för att optimera sina kundupplevelser och marknadsföringsprocesser. Vår uppgift är att hjälpa våra kunder att designa, implementera och vidareutveckla sina CX-strategier genom effektiva och datadrivna Marketing Automation-lösningar.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Genomföra förstudier och analyser för att förstå kundens behov och definiera lösningar inom CX och Marketing Automation.
* Implementera och optimera kampanjflöden i verktyg som Adobe Campaign, Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud och Symplify.
* Utveckla strategier för kundresor och segmentering som maximerar engagemang och affärsnytta.
* Stötta kunder i att skapa personaliserade och automatiserade kommunikationsflöden.
* Fungera som rådgivare och expert inom Marketing Automation och CX, både internt och externt.
* Driva projekt och samordna insatser mellan olika intressenter för att säkerställa framgångsrika leveranser.
* Utforska nya teknologier och metoder för att förbättra kundupplevelser och effektivisera marknadsföringsstrategier.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta strategiskt och operativt med Marketing Automation och Customer Experience-plattformar. Du har ett analytiskt sinne, förståelse för affärsprocesser och en passion för att skapa värde genom digitala kundupplevelser.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 




**👍 Erfarenhet av Adobe Campaign, Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller Symplify.** 




**👍 Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Marketing Automation-projekt i komplexa miljöer.** 




**👍 God förståelse för kundresor, datadriven marknadsföring och segmentering.** 




**👍 En teknisk förståelse och vana att arbeta med integrationer och API:er.** 




**👍 Erfarenhet av att leda och driva projekt, exempelvis som projektledare eller produktägare (meriterande).** 




**👍 Mod och nyfikenhet att ta dig an nya teknologier och arbetssätt.** 




**👍 Stark förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med både tekniska och affärsdrivna team.** 




  





**What is in it for you?** 




**Hos oss får du en flexibel och dynamisk roll med fast ersättning som inte är beroende av din beläggning. Du blir en del av ett energiskt och kompetent team att inspireras av och växa tillsammans med.** 




**Vidare förmåner:** 



* Centralt kontor i Stockholm.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/ år.
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och tjänstepension.
* Spännande uppdrag hos kunder som Klarna, DNB, Tieto och Telenor.
* En inkluderande företagskultur med högt i tak där alla röster räknas.
* Varmt välkommen att bli en del av Leadfronts växande team!

title: Business Unit Director Cloud/IT Services
description:
*Binero IT är ett tillväxtbolag noterat på Nasdaq First North Growth Market. Vi möjliggör hållbar digital utveckling för företag och organisationer med vårt omfattande utbud av IT-tjänster, från robust IT infrastruktur till distribution av TV innehåll för publik verksamhet samt 24/7-support.*
*Vi har fem affärsområden: Nätverkstjänster, Media Distribution, Cloud/IT tjänster, Konsulter och Servicedesk.*
 Vi söker nu en engagerad och
 **driven affärsområdeschef för vårt affärsområde
   

  

 Cloud/IT Services** 
 till vårt kontor i Bromma/Stockholm.
   

  

 Som affärsområdeschef kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att stärka och utveckla vår fortsatta tillväxt och utveckling av affärsområdet
 **Cloud/IT Services.**
 Du kommer dagligen arbeta med att säkerställa och förbättra, samt mätas, på affärsområdets intäkter och lönsamhet genom att bl.a.
   

  

* Driva affärsområdet, inklusive kommersiella strategier som är anpassade efter företagets kort- och långsiktiga mål.
* Delta i ledningsgruppens operativa arbete, du rapporterar till vår CEO.
* Utveckla och designa strategier för tjänsteportföljen som optimerar marknadsandelar och lönsamhet för befintliga och nya produkter/tjänster, tillsammans med marknadsteam och vårt CTO team.
* Ansvara för att ta fram och leverera på affärsområdets säljbudget tillsammans med affärsområdets säljchef.
* Etablera och upprätthålla kontinuerlig kund- och leverantörs kontakt, utveckla partnerskap samt goda relationer tillsammans med säljteamet (BDM.s).
* Bygga upp och anpassa affärsområdet för att säkerställa att teamet är optimerat utifrån såväl organisationsstruktur, processer som nyckeltal.
* Utveckla dina medarbetare och skapar förutsättningar för dem att nå ett starkt affärsmannaskap och goda resultat. Du är ytterst ansvarig för ett team om ca. 10 personer med en säljchef som är direktrapporterande.
* Stötta, följa upp och integrera försäljningsaktiviteter avseende kommersiella delar som inkluderas vid eventuella förvärv.


**Vem är du?**
 Du är en engagerad ledare med ett högt driv och resultatfokus. Ditt ledarskap bygger på omtanke, tillit och tydlighet. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga, vilket bidrar till ett effektivt och konstruktivt arbetssätt och tillsammans med andra når du gemensamt uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Vi har en egen datahall i Vallentuna där vi bl.a. producerar vårt eget Binero Cloud. Det är därför önskvärt att du har en gedigen teknisk förståelse, gärna inom Cloudrelaterade tjänster samt har en hög kompetens och förståelse för det kommersiella delarna som följer dessa tjänster.
   

  

 Du arbetar strategiskt, strukturerat och effektivt och följer upp och återkopplar dina medarbetares och samarbetspartners ansvarsområden och prestationer regelbundet. Du arbetar proaktivt och tar fullt ägarskap över dina ansvarsområden. Du har ett gott beslutsfattande, där besluten fattas utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du erfarenhet av att ha ett helhetsansvar och för att leda och ansvara för affärsutveckling inom it relaterade tjänster. Du har även en stark kommunikationsförmåga på såväl svenska som engelska (tal och skrift).
   

  

 Utbildning och erfarenhet
   

  

* Examen från universitet eller motsvarande kompetens inom business management och/eller IT.
* Minst 10 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom affärsutveckling/försäljning inom IT
* En erfaren lagspelare som drivs av resultat.
* Självgående, kreativ och resultatorienterad
* Trivs med att jobba i en föränderlig miljö, där tillväxt är a och o


 Placeringsort för tjänsten är Bromma/Stockholm, men ansvaret sträcker sig över hela Norden. Tjänsten innebär i snitt 2-3 resdagar/månad.
   

  

 Intervjuer sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Powerhouse of Technology**
 Binero IT bildades 2024 genom en sammanslagning av: Binero, Infrateq och Xpeedio, men gemensamt har dessa tre företag mer än 20 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Tillsammans levererar vi omfattande och robusta tekniska lösningar samlade under vårt gemensamma ”Powerhouse of Technology”.
   

  

 Som ett Powerhouse of Technology erbjuder vi en omfattande produkt- och tjänsteportfölj för företag som värdesätter
 **teknologisk innovation och effektivitet** 
 , oavsett storlek.
   

  

 Oavsett om det handlar om projektledning av digital transformation, molntjänster, digital mediadistribution, utveckling eller IT-support, har vi den expertis och kapacitet som krävs för att
 **leverera resultat av högsta klass.**
 Binero IT har huvudkontor i Stockholm och är cirka 110 anställda representerade i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Danmark.
   

  

 Vi har nyligen även förvärvat Serit Tromsø i Norge, där vi tillträder under våren, i och med det förvärvet tillkommer ca. 50 medarbetare.

title: Swedala Tak söker Regionchef – Södra Sverige
description:
*Swedala Tak är ett franchisekoncept som skapar förutsättningar för många lokala företagare att bli framgångsrika. Vår vision är att bli hela Sveriges Takmästare och Sveriges ledande leverantör av takbyten samt solcellsinstallationer till privatkunder. Vi visar att det går att leverera byggentreprenadtjänster med god lönsamhet utan att ge avkall på kvalitet, säkerhet, arbetsmiljö samt arbetsvillkor. I slutet av 2024 hade Swedala Tak 30 Takmästare utspridda över Mellansverige, Kronoberg samt Västra Götaland. Målsättningen är en fortsatt kraftigt tillväxt under de kommande åren.*
**Swedala Tak – Vi bygger framtidens tak och solenergilösningar**
 Swedala Tak säljer och levererar tak- och solcellsmontage till privatpersoner. Vi är en nationell franchisekedja med stark tillväxt och genomför årligen ett stort antal rekryteringar av nya franchisetagare. Vår verksamhet är byggd på våra kärnvärden – kundnöjdhet, kvalitet och säkerhet. Vi är stolta över våra nöjda kunder och framgångsrika franchisetagare och siktar nu på att växa ytterligare. Vill du vara med och leda vår expansion?
   

  

**Regionchef – Södra Sverige**
 Är du en driven och resultatorienterad ledare med passion för försäljning och coachning? Har du erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning och ledarskap, samt en vilja att se andra lyckas? Swedala Tak söker nu en engagerad och målmedveten Regionchef för Södra Sverige!
   

  

**Din roll och ansvarsområden**
 Som Regionchef spelar du en nyckelroll inom Swedala Tak och fungerar som den primära länken mellan våra franchisetagare, Takmästarna, och servicekontoret. Ansvarsområdet omfattar coachning och utveckling av ett team på 10-15 franchisetagare, där fokus ligger på att säkerställa uppsatta försäljningsmål, bibehålla hög kundnöjdhet och säkerställa en trygg arbetsmiljö. Arbetet sker huvudsakligen på fältet där du agerar strategisk partner för Takmästarna. Genom aktivt stöd i försäljning, sambesök och utbildning skapas en långsiktig och hållbar affärsutveckling. Regelbunden uppföljning och analys av försäljningsresultat blir en central del av arbetet, där insikter används för att identifiera och maximera tillväxtmöjligheter. Franchisetagarna arbetar utifrån Swedala Taks affärsmodell och värdegrund, och en viktig del av rollen är att säkerställa att dessa principer efterlevs. Utöver detta ingår implementering och uppföljning av marknadsaktiviteter, kampanjer och strategier för ökad lokal synlighet.
   

  

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
 Vi letar efter en person med passion för försäljning och ledarskap. Förmågan att bygga förtroende och skapa starka relationer är avgörande, liksom ett strukturerat och målmedvetet arbetssätt. Erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning till privatpersoner är en förutsättning, likaså vana vid att coacha och leda säljteam, gärna inom franchise- eller försäljningsdriven verksamhet. Ett starkt affärstänk i kombination med god förståelse för företagsekonomi värderas högt. Hög energinivå och en vilja att bidra till både individuell och gemensam framgång är viktiga egenskaper. Grundläggande kunskaper i IT och digitala verktyg samt intresse för att lära ut dem till andra behövs i rollen. B-körkort och en livssituation som möjliggör resor inom regionen är ett krav. Kunskap eller intresse för takbranschen är meriterande, men inget krav – det viktiga är förmågan att driva försäljning och leda andra till framgång.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos Swedala Tak blir du en del av en stark och engagerad organisation där vi värdesätter samverkan, driv och utveckling. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att påverka och driva affären framåt. Swedala Tak Sales Academy är vår interna säljutbildning som ger dig och våra franchisetagare de bästa förutsättningarna att lyckas. Du får tillgång till ett starkt varumärke och en beprövad affärsmodell att luta dig mot. Vi erbjuder en attraktiv ersättningsmodell med grundlön och provisionsdel, samt tjänstebil, dator och telefon.
   

  

**Tjänsten i korthet**
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst på tillsvidarebasis. Huvudkontoret är baserat i Borlänge, men du utgår från hemmet. Tillträde sker omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Swedala Tak med Lundin & Boström. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Peter Boström på 073-826 71 00, eller Henrik Camitz via e-post: henrik.camitz@swedalatak.se Mer information finns på www.swedalatak.se. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår hemsida www.lundinbostrom.se. Ansök så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2025-03-24, då vi är nyfikna på dig! Ansökningar behandlas löpande.

title: Senior IT-arkitekt
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Som IT-arkitekt kommer du att planera och leda arkitekturarbetet inom initiativ relaterade till Mobility. Detta innebär att identifiera affärsbehov, producera och bryta ner lösningsdesign till epics, features, och user stories. Du kommer också att ansvara för att samordna prioriteringar och omfång med utvecklingsgrupper samt delta i "big room planning". Ett av våra nuvarande fokusområden är att förbättra vår fakturering, så erfarenhet inom detta område är en fördel.
   

  

**Kompetenskrav:**
* Stark förståelse för lösningsarkitektur
* Strategiskt tänkesätt
* Förmåga att bygga och upprätthålla relationer
* Erfarenhet av att planera och leda arkitekturarbete
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med epics, features och user stories
* Förmåga att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team
* Erfarenhet från faktureringsdomänen (meriterande)
* Kommunicerar obehindrat i på Svenska och Engelska i tal och skrift


**Omfattning: 100%**
**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Incident Manager (CSIRT)
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for an Incident Manager to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Incident Response domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 340 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for an Incident Manager who wants to make a difference in our CSIRT.
   

  

**CSIRT (Cybersecurity Incident Response Team)**
 Our Cybersecurity Incident Response Team (CSIRT) manages most of the large cybersecurity incidents in Sweden and a lot internationally. The team consists of dedicated experts in forensics, advanced infrastructure, and incident management, and works tirelessly to solve the most challenging technical situations. Together, we have rescued countless global organizations from cyber attacks and helped them get back to business with minimal impact.
   

  

**The Role**
 In this role, you will be a part of the Incident Response team (CSIRT) at Truesec, granting you the opportunity to work with some of the best security specialists in the world. When an IT environment is compromised, sensitive data is leaked or encrypted, or unauthorized activity is detected, customers call us. When we get the call, we respond immediately.
   

  

 We then initiate a forensic investigation to determine the entry point, affected systems, and potential data extraction. The incident manager coordinates digital forensics, infra and recovery specialist and if needed crisis management and cyberlaw. Besides our own team you also communicate and coordinate together with the customers to be able to meet their requirements and priorities. Our priority is always to get the customers operational capacity back up in the most effective yet secure way possible so we in parallel to the forensics investigation we start to rebuild the infrastructure and salvage as much data as possible to be able to recover that operational capacity to minimize downtime for the customer's business.
   

  

 Customers often compare our arrival to an emergency response team, experiencing relief when we are onsite.
   

  

 You will lead the incidents described above and the role can be compared to an IT project manager, but the project is running at hyper speed. You will also help our customers as an advisor in the IT security domain.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 You must be good at communicating with stakeholders in the spectrum from developers to senior management in order to advise organizations, both in proactive engagements as well as reactive situations such as a breach. You have experience of leading IT projects and staff (both internal and external). You have solid experience with security solutions and security best practices in on-prem and cloud environments.
   

  

 You also must be familiar with information and data protection challenges and how they affect the business. To succeed in the role, we believe you have several years of experience of working in IT security. Experience in strategic customer relations, including negotiations and contracting is as well as knowledge and experience in cybersecurity incident response is meritorious.
   

  

 To be able to lead, listen and advise customers during crisis is an important skill.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Technical understanding and knowledgeable in IT security (knowledge of security mechanisms and existing products and solutions)
* IT Architectural, infrastructure and/or system knowledge and experience
* Understanding of compliance, regulations, and legal requirements
* Be able to handle changing conditions, always solution-oriented and comfortable making decisions under pressure


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship or citizenship in another EU country. Language skills in English and Swedish or Danish is required.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: IT- och digitaliseringsansvarig
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Project Management
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Financial Services, and Household Services
description:
***Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar inom en organisation med samhällsansvar? HBV söker nu en IT- och digitaliseringsansvarig som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för vår IT-miljö och bidra till vår digitala transformation.***




**Om oss** 




  





 HBV är en inköpsfunktion som ägs av Sveriges allmännyttiga bostadsbolag. Verksamheten drivs utan vinstintressen och eventuellt överskott ges tillbaka till våra medlemmar. Vi genomför upphandlingar för varor och tjänster kopplade till byggnation, renovering och förvaltning av fastigheter. Med närmare 200 ramavtal hjälper vi dagligen våra drygt 400 medlemmar att förvalta och utveckla boendet för sina hyresgäster
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag** 




 I denna roll får du en unik möjlighet att arbeta både operativt, taktiskt och strategiskt. Du blir en nyckelperson i HBV:s digitala utveckling och kommer att driva frågor som rör digitalisering, IT-säkerhet och systemförvaltning. Du ansvarar för de gemensamma IT- resurserna, programvaror, hårdvara och tillhörande tjänster och säkerställer till exempel förvaltning och inköp.
 



 HBV är en organisation med snabba beslutsvägar och vi har en kultur där alla hjälps åt. Vi har en omfattande digital verksamhet, där vår genomfaktureringsmodell hanterar 1,8 miljoner fakturor per år. Nu söker vi dig som vill ta nästa steg och leda vårt arbete mot en ännu mer effektiv och säker IT-miljö.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden** 



* Leda, förvalta och vidareutveckla IT och digitalisering.
* Säkerställa en säker, stabil och användarvänlig IT-miljö med fokus på IT-säkerhet.
* Planera och leda IT-funktionen i det dagliga arbetet.
* Styrning och uppföljning av leverantörer, SLA och kostnader för köpta IT-tjänster.
* Samarbeta med förvaltningsansvariga, processägare eller specialister för att förbättra systemstödet.
* Optimera vår modell för systemförvaltning samt godkänna systeminköp.
* Projektleda till exempel upphandling och införande av IT-driftpartner och IT-supportpartner.
* Stötta organisationen i digitaliseringsinitiativ, inklusive AI-användning.
* Öka vår generella digitala mognad, genom olika informationsaktiviteter.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av IT och digitalisering.
* Förståelse för molntjänster, AI och IT-säkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en Microsoft-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av att styra och följa upp leverantörer inom IT-drift och IT-support.
* God förmåga att kommunicera och presentera IT-relaterade frågor för olika målgrupper.



  





 Du är en engagerad, strukturerad och lösningsorienterad lagspelare. Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En fantastisk arbetsplats med kontor centralt i Globenområdet.
* En socialt trygg arbetsmiljö – vi är certifierade som ett "Great Place to Work".
* Kollektivavtal och förmåner såsom friskvårdsbidrag, SL-kort och sjukvårdsförsäkring.
* En kultur som präglas av samarbete, frihet under ansvar och en stark vilja att utvecklas.



  





**Låter det intressant?** 




 I denna rekrytering tar vi hjälp av vår partner
 **Abright** 
 så vill du veta mer om rollen så ta gärna kontakt med Hanna Dynesius,
 **hanna@abright.se** 
 070-224 04 90.
 



  





 Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så sök redan idag.
 



  





**Välkommen in i värmen!**

title: Product Design Intern, Merchant Team
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a
 **Product Design Intern** 
 to join Wolt’s Merchant team!
   

  

 Wolt Merchant team focuses on making Wolt an integral part of our Merchants’ daily lives in all the 28+ countries Wolt is active in. We provide our business partners with tools and automations that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships.
   

  

 This role is ideal for a designer with a visual design background, eager to apply their skills to the user experience field. You’ll focus on creating delightful interaction designs and stunning interfaces for web and mobile.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Ideate, create, and deliver solutions within a predefined scope.
* Gather feedback and iterate solutions to reach Wolt’s design standards.
* Prepare handoffs for developers and QA to ensure implementation quality.
* Support communication and marketing plans for particular releases or solutions.
* Participate in design and product meetings, brainstorming sessions, reviews, workshops, and other design practices.


**Our humble expectations**
 We hope you’re excited about this opportunity because you:
   

  

* Have High empathy for your audience and the ability to anticipate user needs.
* Have a strongtrong eye for detail in typography, color, and visual design.
* Are proficient in Figma as the main design tool.
* Have basic prototyping skills for interaction design and idea validation.
* Understand the end-to-end design process.
* Are located in Stockholm, able to visit the office at least once a week.
* Are eligible to work in Sweden for the duration of the program (no relocation or visa support available).


 You will get extensive support and mentoring from the Wolt community to help you learn and grow into your role. This is a
 **full-time paid position in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 and it
 **will last 4 months** 
 . The salary will be 35.127 SEK/month. After the internship, your compensation will be re-negotiated to a full-time employee package.
   

  

 Read more about the stories of our ex-Design interns here.
   

  

**Next Steps**
 1 -
 **Apply with a portfolio (slides, PDF, or website) showcasing 1-2 projects you have worked on** 
 . If you submit your portfolio using a link, remember to check permissions! If we cannot access the file, we cannot review your portfolio and proceed with your application.
   

  

 2 - Click “Apply now”, fill in your details, and attach your portfolio. If you have a CV and want to tell us more about yourself and your interests in a cover letter, feel free to include that as well.
   

  

 3 - Send your application!
   

  

**Please note that the portfolio is a mandatory part of the application. Applications without attached portfolios won’t be accepted.**
**The deadline for applications is March 7th** 
 . We will contact selected applicants after the deadline. The first round of interviews is held the week after the deadline. After that, the process includes a home assignment, a second interview with a Design Lead, and a final interview with our Design Director.
   

  

 All interviews will be online.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.*
***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion***
*We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*
*Join us today to build Wolt together.*

title: Regional Trust & Safety Manager - North Region
description:
**Job Description**
 Trust and Safety focuses on proactively identifying, managing, and mitigating risks in real-time. The team also works hands-on to ensure swift, effective, and empathetic responses to incidents while continuously improving the safety of our platform. We take ownership of challenges and are relentless in finding practical solutions so that everyone can feel safe while using Wolt - be it for ordering, delivering, or selling goods.
   

  

 As the Regional Trust and Safety Manager for Wolt’s North region you’ll take full ownership of understanding the top risks, identifying root causes, and rolling up your sleeves to solve issues in the region. You’ll be responsible for developing and launching Controls (product, policies, processes) across the North region’s 9 markets: Finland, Sweden, Estonia, Denmark, Latvia, Lithuania, Norway, and Iceland. You’ll also serve as the go-to expert for escalations, balancing strategic direction with hands-on execution. .
   

  

 Our North region is where our “home” country is (Finland), and where a lot of regulatory and legal nuances are present. In order to be successful in this role, you’ll need to be a proactive, independent, and determined individual with strong stakeholder management skills, grit, and creativity to get things done when faced with challenges. You will need to navigate ambiguity, manage competing priorities and step in personally when necessary to drive solutions forward. This could mean engaging directly with internal and external stakeholders, participating in operational fixes or resolving urgent escalations.
   

  

 The ideal candidate is a natural leader who is just as comfortable setting strategy as they are jumping in to execute it. They have some experience in safety/risk management, preferably in consumer-facing businesses or technology platforms, and a passion for data driven insights to make informed decisions. You must be comfortable working at both ends of the spectrum: building a regional T&S strategy and rolling up your sleeves to get things done!
   

  

 What you'll be doing:
   

  

* Working hand-in-hand with the North Operations team to build and execute an effective T&S strategy for the region. This means being in the field, directly engaging with stakeholders and following through until resolutions have been achieved.
* Collaborating with Support, Product, Policy, Comms, Legal, and other teams to plan and execute the work required to enable safe growth in the region.
* Owning the North regional T&S strategy and roadmap, being accountable from concept building to the execution and success of the program.
* Identifying gaps, risks and opportunities and understanding root causes for T&S incidents by conducting deep dives, leading investigations, and launching improvements to Wolt’s controls in the region.
* Working with Global T&S Program Managers to develop and improve policies, processes, and products to manage T&S risks and incidents in your region.
* Establishing governance and forums to enable the program’s execution.
* Completing Safety investigations and deep dives.
* Training and empowering regional teams in Trust and Safety topics, making sure they have the knowledge and resources to maintain best practices in daily operations.


**Our humble expectations**
* 4+ years of experience in Platform Operations, Strategy and Planning, Innovation, or Trust and Safety. The ideal candidate comes with expertise in Operations, Trust & Safety, Risk, and/or Fraud.
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills and the ability to work with data and quickly turn it into insights, recommendations and strategies
* Strong project/program management to drive consistent progress towards our goals. You know that a project or program can’t be successful without proper scoping, planning, engagement, governance, and documentation.
* Excellent people skills and the ability to motivate, communicate, and drive various stakeholders including our country teams, global functional teams, and our leadership.
* An independent, problem-solving mindset and a preference for high-paced dynamic environments where you have an opportunity to step in and drive solutions without waiting for direction.
* Grit, creativity, and determination to drive a program independently even when things get tough. If things get blocked, you’ll need to find solutions or compromises to unblock them.
* Experience in building out and scaling new processes, policies, and/or products.
* Knowledge of the services we offer and genuine interest in Wolt and our industry.
* You are living in or willing to reallocate to the North region main hubs (Helsinki, Copenhagen, Oslo, Stockholm, or Vilnius) and you’re willing to travel between these locations as required.
* You are able to work and communicate effectively in English.


**Next Steps**
 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

***Join us today to build Wolt together.***

title: Consulting Account Partner - Nordics
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Telecommunications
description:
Our client, a leading global IT service provider, is recruiting for a
 **Consulting Account Partner** 
 to join their business in
 **the Nordics region.** 




  





  





**Position Title:Consulting Account Partner - Nordics** 




**Position Type:** 
 Permanent
 



**Start Date:** 
 ASAP
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden/Norway/Finland
 



**Contact:** 
 Bojan Ulemek | +49 89 23 88 98 671
 



  





  





**Job Description:** 




 As a Consulting Partner, you will truly be a start-up CEO, with autonomy to define your own path.
 



 Our client is looking for an experienced business consulting leader to join their team, focusing on Success & Growth for their clients and consulting business. If you are keen to make an impact and shape the future of business, while learning from C-level stakeholders and accelerating your career, read on to learn more!
 



 You’ll be working with some of the most senior people, to establish business value and future direction. You’ll have a unique opportunity to understand the bigger picture.
 



 You’ll have the opportunity to shape the future strategy and direction, collaborating with our various business units. You’ll have the opportunity to help execute strategies and be a part of big transformative initiatives, working with the C-Suite to facilitate business growth. This is a role with a high degree of exposure to Senior Leadership. You’ll have the unparalleled opportunity to work with and learn from these senior leaders.
 



  





  





**Role Overview:** 



* **Advisor**
 for planning, designing, implementing, and supporting business transformation programs of clients, including transformation assessment, framework development & implementation, new products design, digital & sales technology tools.
* **Problem solver**
 , providing solutions on specific areas of transformation initiatives, for example digital enablement, business improvement and operations infrastructure optimization.
* Working together with Leadership on devising business strategies aimed at improving sales productivity, process standardization, digital tool adoption, and overall business performance improvement.
* Working with a team, to provide end-to-end solutions including process analysis and design, requirements planning, business case development.
* **Contributor**


 to business development with shadow P&L responsibility and thought leadership for the consulting business unit through participation in areas such as training, methodology and toolkit development.



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Establish credentials as a trusted advisor with customer stakeholders
* Ideate with customers to create proactive and innovative proposals around business problems
* Set up vision and strategic goals for the consulting business for the assigned industry vertical / region in alignment with larger goals
* Work with internal stakeholders (regional and vertical sales teams, other service lines) to develop and execute an annual business plan
* Engage with sales, delivery and account teams to support revenue growth in targeted existing and new accounts through proactive proposals and RFP responses
* Drive consulting marketing agenda in the assigned industry vertical / target accounts
* Evaluate market needs, competition landscape, to identify & propose new consulting capabilities and services for the specific needs of the industry vertical / region
* Provide governance, oversight and lead, if required, consulting engagements in the assigned industry vertical / region
* Hire / motivate / mentor consulting team to meet business goals
* Personally contribute in establishing thought leadership for the consulting practice in the region and globally



  





**Education or Work Experience:** 



* Experience as Sr. Manager/ Director in a Consulting firm of repute.
* Track record of delighting clients through outstanding consultative work
* Experience of working at the front end of technology solution-ing building use cases and business case
* Experience in leading workshops for complex problem-solving using approaches like design thinking
* Experience in building up a consulting team (hiring / mentoring etc)



  





**Basic Qualifications :** 



* Bachelor’s degree from a leading school
* IT Services industry expert with specialization in one or more areas - Industrial Machinery / Automotive / Pharma / Process (chemical industry), Retail, Healthcare, Finance etc.
* Demonstrated experience in leading consulting engagements blending strategy, operating models, and technology, to delivering new age propositions across the business value chain.
* Well-developed core consulting skills of research, analysis, presentation, and attention to detail
* Aptitude to grasp new concepts and effectively produce results.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills – an analytical, innovative, and creative mindset
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to be self-directed and be an independent contributor to the team.
* Native local language speaker



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* MBA from a leading business school
* 12-15+ years of consulting experience
* Strong facilitation skills; excellent oral and written business communication skills
* Experience of working in Agile
* Proficiency with Process modeling tools such as ARIS / Visio / Bizagi
* Lean & Six Sigma Certifications (Preferred, not mandatory)
* Ability to lead teams with a sound work ethic, intellectual curiosity, and exceptional client service.



  





**Personality and Interpersonal Skills:** 



* Ability to structure and manage intensive workloads.
* A worthy team player, dedicated to contributing toward the outcome desired by the team.
* High degree of emotional intelligence to effectively deal with increasingly diverse clients and teams.
* Confidence and maturity to work with senior executives.

title: Customer Technology Advisor - Application Services (Nordics)
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a Customer Technology Advisor and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the practice-specific domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in a practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus area(s) including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Solution Specialist till e-ID teamet
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Visste du att CGI levererar viktiga tjänster som utgör ryggraden i Sveriges digitala ekosystem med legitimationslösningar som BankID, Freja eID, eIDAS, Telia och SITHS! Med över 30 miljoner e-ID transaktioner per månad är vi marknadsledande i Sverige.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Solution Specialist till vårt teknikteam för eID som idag består av fem medarbetare. Vi vidareutvecklar vår eID-tjänst kontinuerligt och vi anpassar den både avseende legala krav och utefter marknadsmässiga önskemål. Dessutom utvecklas tjänsten också utifrån alla goda idéer som kommer från våra medarbetare!
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm, Örebro, Sundsvall , Malmö eller Östersund
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I den här rollen får du möjligheten att forma en teknisk framtid och ständigt höja ribban för våra tjänster. Varje dag är en chans att inte bara hantera den dagliga driften och finjustera vår infrastruktur, utan även att vara arkitekten bakom kontinuerlig innovation och vidareutveckling av vår tjänst.
   

  

 I din roll som specialist kommer du att möta utmaningar i form av tekniska frågor och förfrågningar från kunder. Det innebär bland annat att öppna dörrar till kreativa lösningar för kunder både i text och genom möten.
   

  

 Att vara en del av våra affärsprojekt innebär att delta i och vara en katalysator för förändring. Det innebär även att arbeta sida vid sida med kompetenta kollegor inom utveckling och affärsprojektledning där vi tar fram underlag till anbud eller förfrågningar som innebär förändring.
   

  

 I denna roll får du stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att ta egna initiativ. Du kommer att arbeta med att förstå och lösa komplexa utmaningar, där din analytiska förmåga blir avgörande. En viktig del av ditt arbete är att dokumentera och beskriva förändringar på ett tydligt och noggrant sätt, vilket gör att din erfarenhet av dokumentation och ditt öga för detaljer kommer väl till pass.
   

  

 Du kommer också att bidra aktivt i samarbetet med kollegor, där du utmanar och inspirerar till nya lösningar. Din struktur och självgående arbetssätt hjälper dig att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt och driva ditt arbete framåt med engagemang.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en teknisk bredd då arbetsuppgifterna kommer att spänna över ett brett spektrum. Vi har idag en fin gemenskap i teamet och lägger därför stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper så som, god kommunikationsförmåga, engagemang och problemlösningsförmåga.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Relevant utbildning med inriktning mot IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Teknisk kommunikation/nätverkskunskap
* Goda kunskaper i Linux
* Grundläggande kunskaper i PKI
* Tidigare erfarenhet av stark autentisering
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**För den här tjänsten är svenskt medborgarskap ett krav.**
 Meriterande är erfarenhet inom något eller några av följande områden:
   

  

* Hantering av databaser, framför allt PostgreSQL och MongoDB
* Kunskap inom Containermiljöer, speciellt Docker
* Webb-portaler och kundkommunikation
* Minst ett script-/programmeringsspråk, särskilt Bash, Perl, Python eller Java
* Kunskap kring PTS, DIGG:s och eIDAS uppdrag kring eLegitimationer
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap
* Erfaranhet av lösningsarkitekt inom SAML/OIDC


**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vill du vara med och ta fram nästa generations e-legitimationslösningar? Då ska du söka den här tjänsten! Om du har några frågor eller funderingar kontakta gärna Patrik Kosowski, Manager Consuling Delivery via mail patrik.kosowski@cgi.com
   

  

 Mer information om eID-tjänsten hittar du här:
   

  

 https://www.cgi.com/se/sv/business-process-services/elektronisk-identifiering-och-underskrift/e-id-och-e-legitimation
   

  

**Mer information om våra förmåner:**
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Regulatory Compliance Manager
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Investment Banking
description:
**ABOUT OUR COMPANY** 




 Xoala is a leading provider of payment solutions, committed in streamlining global finances, though empowering businesses with innovative, secure, and efficient financial services. Xoala offers an all-in-one platform that allows you to handle international transactions, manage accounts in multiple currencies, and process payments securely— no matter where in the world you do business.
 



  





 As we continue to expand, we’re seeking talented individuals to drive our strategic growth, develop a high-performing organization. Explore our career opportunities and become part of a team that is shaping the future of payment solutions.
 



  





**WE ARE LOOKING FOR** 




 Xoala is looking for a
 **Regulatory Compliance Manager** 
 to join our international team of talented individuals. As the Regulatory Compliance Manager, you will be responsible to oversee and ensure compliance with Swedish financial regulations.
